title: PhilixCrpt
author: PhilixCrpt
content: Hi everyone, I am indeed glad to be on this platform. I just joined and in just some few hours surfing through various posts on Bitcoin, I have learnt so much.I love the integrity of this platform and it makes one feels very safe here knowing how fraud has increased all over the World.With Bitcoin, people are able to make genuine living. This has helped in reducing the rate of crimes and frauds in Africa, especially amongst the teaming and unemployed Youths.Bitcoin is a game changer and a blessing to this he generation.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Quote from: PhilixCrpt on January 19, 2023, 05:16:04 PMI love the integrity of this platform and it makes one feels very safe here knowing how fraud has increased all over the World.Well guess what dude — Bitcointalk is just as unsafe as most community platforms on the world wide web. Same with other social platforms, you just need to ignore(or better yet, report) the spam/scams and focus on the good topics/conversations.

comments.author: DaNNy001
comments.body: Welcome to the forum and yes bitcoin is indeed a wonderful initiative but its still used and abused by some people out there as loop hole to so many cyber related crimes as it is known that in nature anything that has good sides also has bad sides so i would advise to be very cautious even here in the forum some folks are just to lurking around to scam other but the forum will guide you in advices on the do's and don't that are involved in the crypto space. For example ~it not safe for one to store there coins in exchange platform ~always keep your coins in an offline wallet ~always report any suspicious pm from any member in the forum  so many more just be willing you are here to learn and ask questions about things you don't know.

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: You're welcome to this forum, pls ensure you adhere to the forum's rules and regulations https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0 this will help guide you through what and what is expected of you as a newbie, you can also find this mega thread of an interest to you whereby you can easily locate and read about a particular aspect you wanted to learn from, its a collection of useful threads from members that can help beginners as they start their bitcoin journey, its Beginners and Help Encyclopediahttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5364418.0#post_point118 be punctual and active, don't assume what you don't know, learn and improve yourself, make use of the forum search button to extend your research or ask questions in aspect that have not been discussed before.

comments.author: BlackHatCoiner
comments.body: Welcome aboard!Note that this topic fits better in the Meta board, as that's where the forum-related discussions are made. You can move it there by clicking here or in the "move topic" link down in this page. Or don't, if you think it fits the Bitcoin discussion. Also, take your time to read the forum rules: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0.I hope you learn a lot.

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: Welcome to the forum mate, from your post it seems you might have had an idea somewhere else or from a member here about the forum. Before proceeding to ask any question or add posts please do well to use the search button to avoid spamming. You can learn how to use it through this link; https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5276341.0.Quote from: PhilixCrpt on January 19, 2023, 05:16:04 PMWith Bitcoin, people are able to make genuine living. This has helped in reducing the rate of crimes and frauds in Africa, especially amongst the teaming and unemployed Youths.Bitcoin is a game changer and a blessing to this he generation.The arrival of bitcoin and cryptocurrency at large has created job opportunities for some people but the rates of crimes hasn’t reduced the way you put it. In fact there are people who hide behind bitcoin to scam people or either hack wallets.In Africa, bitcoin has help its investors to save their funds without fear of inflation and also to transfer money through the continent without undergoing the rigorous processes of banks.

comments.body: Welcome to The forum, hope you do enjoy your stay here. Consider moving this thread as suggested above to a more appropriate board. I could report it, but I prefer newer members going about the process themselves than just discovering their thread has been moved and not understanding why.Quote from: PhilixCrpt on January 19, 2023, 05:16:04 PMI love the integrity of this platform and it makes one feels very safe here knowing how fraud has increased all over the World.The forum does not have an inbuilt scam regulation system for this exact reason; you are not safe here on the forum or anywhere on the internet.Quote from: PhilixCrpt on January 19, 2023, 05:16:04 PMWith Bitcoin, people are able to make genuine living. comments.author: Bitstar_coin
comments.body: Well hope you find this place informative enough for your btc journey. There are different boards with lots of info to help you get started. Btc is an interesting tech which everyone deserves to know about, you should count yourself among the lucky ones to have come to know btc this early. Welcome to the forum.

comments.author: Ndabagi01
comments.body: Welcome to the forum, I hope you’ll have a good time here to learn and broaden your knowledge on bitcoin and cryptocurrency at large.Quote from: Zaguru12 on January 19, 2023, 06:26:34 PMThe arrival of bitcoin and cryptocurrency at large has created job opportunities for some people but the rates of crimes hasn’t reduced the way you put it. In fact there are people who hide behind bitcoin to scam people or either hack wallets.It's also worth noting that the crimes and criminal activities associated with bitcoin have existed for a long time before bitcoin itself. They could be using it as a shield to conceal their criminal activity, but bitcoin has nothing to do with it and does not encourage it in any way. This is one of the reasons it has yet to be accepted as legal tender throughout the world. I hope the bitcoin jinx is broken soon and bitcoin becomes widely accepted.

Not all informations you would read, will be based on facts especially if it is opinionated. As you learn new things you'd be able to identify which information should you keep and use , as well as info you should disregard. That is a part of learning process I think.

How many people come to this forum to try and scam people.... and the "community" Police jump onto those threads to expose them. comments.body: Bitcoin can indeed provide opportunities for people to make a living, but they have to try hard because now many people know this bitcoin's potential. comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: If you say curiosity brought with here, then your curiosity has brought you to the right place and that's a good motive for joining already unlike some others who are attracted to this forum for other reasons.Quote from: PhilixCrpt on January 19, 2023, 05:16:04 PMWith Bitcoin, people are able to make genuine living.  I have read this so many times and still cannot really wrap my head around what you mean by with bitcoins people are able to make a genuine living. It sounds like something that can be misinterpreted by beginners to mean that bitcoin is a get-rich quick scheme and that depending on bitcoin alone without having any other plans is okay. It is not so. If you've gone through so many discussions on this forum you find out that the general advice is also that you should not completely depend on bitcoins and investments in cryptocurrency for your livelihood. So how do people make a living from bitcoin? are they really HODLing?To correct you OP, I will say that bitcoin has offered hope for people in Africa to get out of poverty through purposeful and smart investments in it, not just an avenue to make a living like you suggest.
